div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

div.p:
Good afternoon parents. We as a district have determined that it is in the best interest of our students and community to close school at the end of the day today. Staff are working diligently today to prepare learning materials for students while the shutdown exists. Administration will be working to provide resources and communications to you via our website to...
READ MORE >

THE RISK IN WISCONSIN REMAINS LOW Novel coronavirus, also known as COVID-19, continues to spread worldwide. The current risk to Trempealeau County and surrounding residents remains low, even as additional cases have been reported in the United States. For this reason, residents should prepare, but not panic. Health officials suggest having at least a 72-hour...
READ MORE >

We are currently in need of an individual to drive a school van for transportation in the morning and afternoon. Applicants must possess a valid driver's license and have a clean driving record. If you are interested please stop in to the district office to fill out an application, or call Joshua Skoug at (715) 695-2696 ext. 300 for more information.
READ MORE >

When dropping off E-S Elementary Students please do not block the handicap accessible parking spaces. These spaces need to be open for our student vans and those in need. Please pull ahead and park along the curb in-front of the glass windows north of the entrance for drop-off. Thank you, E-S Elementary School
READ MORE >

Spring Parent-Teacher Conferences are scheduled from 4:00-7:30pm on Thursday, February 27th and Tuesday, March 3rd.If you are the parent of a 4K-5th grade student you can schedule a conference with your student's teacher by contacting Sue Svoma at (715) 695-2696 ext. 101. If you are the parent of a 6th-12th grade student you can schedule a conference with your...
READ MORE >

On April 7th, 2020 the School District of Eleva-Strum will be holding a 3-year $575,000 non-recurring operating referendum. We will be providing information about the referendum via our social media outlets as well as our website. You can find the website by going to www.esschools.k12.wi.us --> Menu --> Community --> April 2020 Operating Referendum or...
READ MORE >

Please join us Monday, February 17th at 6:30pm in the High School Auditorium for a presentation by Dr. Justin Patchin.This presentation will cover a broad overview of cyberbullying, including issues parents, educators, and teens need to know about how youth use and misuse technology to cause harm to their peers. The presentation will define and provide examples of...
READ MORE >

ALL PARCELS ARE SOLDThe School District of Eleva-Strum will be accepting bids on the following parcels of land: In the Village of Eleva: Vacant land parcel totaling approximately 1.25 acres, bordering U.S. Highway 10 (Mondovi Street) and South Third Street. In the Village of Strum: Parcel A 2.04 acres, Parcel B 2.02 acres, Parcel C 1.77 acres, and Parcel D .40...

The term of office for school board member is three years beginning on Monday, April 20, 2020. Office --...

We recognized that there are multiple other extra-curricular events that are scheduled on December 5th (per the Cardinal News), in doing so we have rescheduled the Holiday Concert for Monday, December 2, 2019. The details are below, mark your calendar: Winter/Holiday Concert Monday, December 2, 2019 Gr. 4-K, K, 1, 2 at 6 P.M. Gr. 3, 4, 5th grade band at 7 P.M.

img.alt: Fire Safety at the Eleva-Strum Elementary School

div.a: Fire Safety at the Eleva-Strum Elementary School

div.p:
This past week we had the opportunity to learn about fire safety from some of our own, "Volunteer Fire Fighters and Safety Personnel." We would like to thank all them for taking time out of their days and for making this learning experience such a great annual event. Enjoy some photos of the day.

The elementary photos have finally arrived. Thank you for your patience. Please check them over and if you would like to have them retaken make sure your child is ready to smile this Friday. Once again thank you for your patience.Retakes:Friday, October 18, 2019

img.alt: What Do Teachers Do on Days When the Kids Stay Home?

div.a: What Do Teachers Do on Days When the Kids Stay Home?

div.p:
The Eleva-Strum Cardinal Teaching Staff put in a great day of professional development. The goal was to ensure that the students in our district have a Guaranteed Viable Curriculum in all areas. This is done through creating a spiral that is transparent and fluid in helping the teachers know that they are reaching all students and pushing them to be best they can...

div.a: Friday, October 11, 2019 There Won't Be School For the Kids

div.p:
Just a quick reminder that there won't be school for the students at Eleva-Strum Schools tomorrow. The teachers will be using this time to grow as educators. Please share~

Every year we have a great deal of clothing unclaimed in our lost and found. Even after showing the items to all of the students, we still have piles of clothing. IF you recognize an item in these pictures please send a note with your child describing it, and we will do our best to get it to them. Thank you~

img.alt: Friendly Reminder of the E-S Schools Start Time

div.a: Friendly Reminder of the E-S Schools Start Time

div.p:
The Eleva-Strum Schools would like to remind everyone that the start of the day is 8 a.m. Please have your children at school shortly before this time. The doors open at 7:30 and breakfast is served from 7:30-7:55.Another reminder is that the school grounds are designated as tobacco free areas. Thanks for your help and cooperation. E-S CardinalsPlease Share

History is a curriculum that helps remind us of what takes place throughout time. Many events are wonderful, but there are some that are not. We often remember those events through tributes to those that lost their lives or their families that live on. I put this tribute together years ago, but I believe it is timeless in the sharing of a historical event, even...
READ MORE >

Going Bananas! It all started with Harley giving me a tree in 2006. I watered it for 13 years. It grew a pod this Spring. The leaves rolled back. And there they were, BANANAS. I shared them on our webpage for our students to see. The Leader Telegram called and set up an interview. It was published in the paper. A Spectrum News reporter from Milwaukee read...
READ MORE >

The Cardinal Staff did some word smithing to produce a possible Vision Statement through the combination of student and staff values. They made connections, discussed, developed, reviewed each others and revised to come up with rough ideas and suggestions.

div.a: The Other Step of the Vision Quest: The Educators

div.p:
After discussing the present mission/vision statement with the teachers at Eleva-Strum, the administrative team presented the student findings to them. Through the use of technology the teachers had the task of filtering through 85 values to come up with the top 10 that resinated with them. The next step in this process will be to weave the student ideas and the...

img.alt: Mr. Skoug Leads A Quest to Create A Vision

div.a: Mr. Skoug Leads A Quest to Create A Vision

div.p:
The Eleva-Strum School District is on a quest to reinvigorate their Vision and Mission Statements. A person may ask the question: Who do you start with? The answer that person would get from the administrative team is the student body. Watch these two short video clips as Mr. Skoug inspires the students to make the vision their own.

Eleva-Strum Elementary parents and guardians, please remember that your children should be at school before 8 a.m. If you would like your child to eat breakfast at school they should arrive at school between 7:30 and 7:45 to give them time to eat and get to class by 8. Please share this around and let those that may be transporting your child to school about this...

div.a: We Have Bananas Growing at the Eleva-Strum Elementary School

div.p:
Bananas! That's right we have bananas growing on our tree in our school. Please share this with your children that go to school at Eleva-Strum Elementary, they all walked by this tree on a weekly basis. The story behind tree started way back in the late 90's. It was given to me by a student that was moving away, and she wanted me to have something to remember...

The third grade had a unique visitor recently, and he brought his partner. Luke the K9 Officer and his partner Officer Hernandez came into visit and talk about the job of a K9 Unit. We greatly appreciate the Trempealeau County Police Department for allowing them to come in and share their responsibilities and their story.

On March 3, 2019 students in Ms. Seidl's 3rd grade class took the UNICEF Kid Power challenge. For the remainder of the year students will be wearing a UNICEF Kid Power band. UNICEF Kid Power gives students the power to save lives by connecting their everyday activity to real-world impact. The band tracks the students steps and movement during the school day. As...
READ MORE >

Tasha inspired the Eleva-Strum students by telling her story and letting them know anything is possible. It doesn't matter what obstacles are put in front of you as long as you stay positive and have a "Pit Crew" for support you can do anything. The students listened intently and loved Tasha's beautiful voice as she sang a song from the Wizard of Oz. Thank you...

Due to circumstances beyond our control, winter in Wisconsin, we have recently had to make some changes to our published school calendar that will affect student days and Parent-Teacher conferences.
First, rather than having an early release on February 28th and no school for students on March 1st, we will be running both days as regular student contact days. ...

With the closure of this chapter we will no longer be identified as the Strum Primary or the Eleva Intermediate...

img.alt: The FUN Begins At Our New Playground

div.p:
It's been two years since our 4th and 5th graders have had a REAL playground to enjoy. THAT has changed and it is exciting! Instead of heading out to an empty lot to play catch, tag, or chase games our 4th and 5th graders are now enjoying the new playground that has been placed right next to their NEW School. Check out a few snap shots of the Fun!!

The Eleva-Strum School District celebrates good things that happen. At the Strum Primary School the students earn B.U.G (Being Unusually Good) slips for doing good things. Captain Sandra Haidvogel visited the first grade on Monday, November 12, to observe Veterans Day. She explained who Veterans are, talked about how to thank Veterans, lead the first graders in the Pledge of Allegiance, and encouraged us to thank Veterans by making cards. div.a: Bookworm Readers Enjoy Our Little People

div.p:
Ann Kisor along with other volunteer readers come in once a month to read a story to the 4K classes. They are a part of the Wisconsin Bookworm Reader Program. After visiting with the students and reading the pre-chosen book, each student is given a personal copy of the read-aloud to take home and reread with their families. This program has been a part of the...

Congrats to the Eleva-Strum football team for earning the distinguished honor of being named Wisconsin Football Coaches Association Team Academic All State. October 29, 2018
Dear Parents,

div.p:
Some of the Hero's in the Eleva and Strum Communities came to the Eleva-Strum Elementary School and provided our students with a great learning experience. The sights, sounds and smells were just a few things that the students learned about. ...

img.alt: Christmas From the Heart Thank You!

div.a: Christmas From the Heart Thank You!

div.p:
The Eleva-Strum School District has been blessed to have the organized gift of giving called, "Christmas From The Heart" for many years. We would like to thank everyone that gives, and those that are behind the scenes making everyone's holiday season a wonderful experience. The lady behind the scenes that coordinates, organizes, and plans this exciting program is...

Seussical The Musical will be performed by the School District of Eleva-Strum this year! The show runs Thursday, November 1st - Sunday, November 4th. All show times are 7:00 P.M. except the final showing on Sunday which is at 1:00 P.M. Please come out and enjoy this tremendous performance. Tickets are $7.00 and can be purchase in the MS/HS Office or at the door.

div.p:
Teacher's know that everyone seems to learn a little differently. Here at Eleva-Strum Elementary School we try to meet everyone's style. It maybe with a partner.......or with a teacher's help (Mrs. Anderson and Mrs. Hanson).......or maybe using technology.......or with a rhyming song to go wash your hands (Mrs. Heldt). Learning can be a great experience and we...

img.alt: Bea Spends Time At the Friday Morning Meeting

div.a: Bea Spends Time At the Friday Morning Meeting

div.p:
Beatrice Ilene is the Eleva-Strum Therapy Dog that spends many days with the students here at our schools. Mrs. Kempf brings her to school to be with our students and build comfort into their day. She has one-on-one time, small group time, play time and even recess with our students. Bea is an Australian Labradoodle and loves spend time at school.

The 5 year old kindergarteners in Mrs. Pedersen's class are learning to sort by attributes. How much more fun can you make class when you get to work with buttons and with a friend. Sorting made fun!
Working together makes sorting with attributes a lot more fun!
What attributes are these two Little Cardinals using to sort their shapes?

Golfer #3 was the Division 3 State Champion Medalist, Golfer #2 had a hole in one and the team earned 2nd place. Also, Golfer #3, Golfer #5 and Golfer #2 are 2017 Honors Academic-All State honorees. WSMA Honors Student Composer Wisconsin School Music Association (WSMA) proudly presents the 2017 Student Composition Project winners. Students from across the state were recognized for outstanding achievement with their original musical work during a special awards program at the Wisconsin Center for Music Education in Waunakee on June 3. Student artist has been selected to receive a Silver Medal in the Blick 2017 “With Art I Can…” Mixed Media Contest. Her mixed media artwork was done using tissue paper, media mixer, and oil pastels.
